blog.description: President Obama will soon be sworn into office, and whether you voted for him or not, he's everybody's president. What do you want him to remember in his second term? We will feature your responses in our inauguration coverage!
blog.title: Dear Mr. President
blog.name: inauguration2013

posts.caption:
Dear Mr. President,

I didn’t vote.

Mr. President,

These are my two brothers and my daughter. They are the future of America.
I did not vote because I am not yet a citizen but my husband voted for the both of us and he voted for you.
I am very disappointed in the time it has taken for Immigration Reform. My family is the perfect example of a generation of immigrants stuck in limbo as some of us can enjoy the “freedoms” such as driver’s licenses and healthcare but some of us cannot. I have to live in fear that friends and family members might be deported.
I have to spend a small fortune to feed my family healthily. GMO labeling should be a no-brainer.

I have health insurance. Yet every time I go to the doctor I have to be afraid of how much the co-payment will be. When I have had the visit the emergency room, I don’t know what is worst, being ill or knowing how much I will have to pay.

I have a daughter, she is my everything. I pray that she will have the chance to have a good education and live a happy life regardless of her gender. I do not want old, rich, white men creating laws that will govern her body or her rights.

Same-sex marriage should be legal. End of story. Where did separation of church and state go?

Everyone has the right to Life, Liberty, and the Persuit of Happiness.

Signed,
Paulyna from Atlanta, Georgia

What do you want President Obama to remember in his second term? Share your message at NPR’s Dear Mr. President.

Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.


You, have the opportunity to make a huge impact in our world by the stroke of a pen. Use that pen wisely, and never forget or take for granted the position you hold and the trust that the people placed in you.

I support you without conditions. Just do the right thing for ALL People.

Respectfully,

Signed,
Gomez Maria from Plano, Texas

What do you want President Obama to remember in his second term? Share your message at NPR’s Dear Mr. President.

Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.

January 15, 2013

Dear Mr. President

You, have the opportunity to make a huge impact in our world by the stroke of a pen. Use that pen wisely, and never forget or take for granted the position you hold and the trust that the people placed in you.

I support you without conditions. Just do the right thing for ALL People.

Respectfully,

Signed,
Gomez Maria from Plano, Texas

What do you want President Obama to remember in his second term? Share your message at NPR’s Dear Mr. President.

Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.

Mr President, I voted for you and always will. I know it takes time to mend the things that have been building for years. More than your 4 years already. I have patience. I believe that with a strong, fair foundation we can grow as a country together if we all understand that some sacrifices will need to be made. It won’t be easy. Our society has grown to a place that frightens me to think of what the future holds without some kind of DRASTIC CHANGES both in Politics and in Mindsets. I know your job must not be easy to try and deal with such opposition in the Congress there, but know that we are behind you 110% Mr President ! Preparation is KEY. Affordable Healthcare will be welcomed, but I also feel that if we, the People started to CARE FOR OURSELVES BETTER with Nutrition that the need for Healthcare will decrease.

I believe in YOU Mr. President, but I am having a tougher time believing in the People. I never learned more about our country than I did living abroad for 7 years. It really opened my eyes up and made me realize how dependent and expectant this country has become. I wish you and your entire team, Republicans included, the best of luck this next term and know that we are by your side every step of the way !!!!!!!!

Signed,
Jason Z. from Chandler, Arizona

What do you want President Obama to remember in his second term? Share your message at NPR’s Dear Mr. President.

Dear Mr. President,

I didn’t vote.

I do believe you should support who wins even if you did not vote for them. I was excited to hear everyone “wanted” to work together on the major economic issues facing the country. However, as a business student I am deeply ashamed by the amount of pork it has taken to just pass a bill. Compromise shouldn’t come in the form of buying someone or their friends. You should be willing to sacrifice some of the main goal. For example, on raising the debt ceiling. It is easy economics to know you must raise taxes (should be on everyone but no one likes that, instead we want everyone else usually the rich to pay for our mistakes) and additionally you must cut spending. An easy solution to this would be we will cut $1 for every dollar you approve in tax increase (or some percentage around there). That would be a negotiation, that is all the American people want to see. Lastly stop blaming the Republicans (I am independent), do you let your daughters blame others? No. So don’t do it, yes they are being stupid at times but you need to go get in the mess of it. I currently think Biden has been more Presidential in how he handled the last two months then you have.

In short please work with others, don’t blame people just keep trying, and lastly don’t promise everyone you will bring us together then put a wall up in negotiations.

Thank you for your time,

A student, who is hoping his leaders will act more like adults than his nephhew.

Signed,
William Manning from Fairfield, Vermont

What do you want President Obama to remember in his second term? Share your message at NPR’s Dear Mr. President.

Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.

Raising the credit limit is not a solution to the debt. Allowing ourselves to make more loans only gets us deeper in debt. I tend to side with democrats, but on this one I think it is clear. More debt ceiling equals more debt. This is NOT good or a solution, and we should live within our means. Pull ALL the money out of Military spending, tax the rich at 90% like they used to be, tax churches, eliminate ALL loopholes and deductions in the tax code, and I bet you’ll be real close. IF not, there are more ideas along this vein. Time to make the tough decisions, not take out more loans.

Signed,
Paul Entrekin from Petal, Ms

What do you want President Obama to remember in his second term? Share your message at NPR’s Dear Mr. President.

Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.

Please don’t forget Africa. Even thought they do not have oil to fight over they are an entire continent in need of the most basic aid. You can do so much for them just by starting a dialogue. Visiting. Letting Americans see how the real other 99% live. My daughter was eight years old last summer when she and I volunteered in Tanzania. We worked at an art’s school for street children and most of the kids are living without parents and with diseases such as TB, AIDS and sickle cell. It was quite powerful to see my daughter, Calla (adopted from Ethiopia) give her lap to the little ones. Watching a sweet set of four year olds leave the school to wander and look for a place to sleep each afternoon was a better education than any school here in America could have offered her. Please put Africa back on the map for Americans we have much to learn from them and it is so easy to help. Thank you. Emma

Signed,
Emma Dodge Hanson from Saratoga Springs NY

What do you want President Obama to remember in his second term? Share your message at NPR’s Dear Mr. President.

Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.

Thank you for remembering about all our Equality.

Signed,
Henry J. Mann from North Little Rock, AR

What do you want President Obama to remember in his second term? Share your message at NPR’s Dear Mr. President.

Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.

Please Mr. President, do not forget where you came from. Do not forget about us regular Americans who do not have a million in the bank. Please be a man of your word just like your grandparents taught you. Please keep your courage when standing up to right-wing bullies and big corporations. You are working for us. You represent us. You’re all we have. Thanks Mr. President!

Signed,
An American from Denver, CO.

What do you want President Obama to remember in his second term? Share your message at NPR’s Dear Mr. President.

Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.

America will not become America again until the illegal prison at Guantanamo is shuttered. You said you cared about that.

Signed,
Philip Chapman-Bell from Northampton, Massachusetts
